pullRequest.body:
Adds the SetLike instance for Quot along with the notion of `Represents`, which says that a Set represents a set of equivalence classes if it contains exactly one element of each class.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This is the more generic version of #20024

### PR summary [19daea86d0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21097/commits/19daea86d0de9d67bba8bbed253d03c827b82a41)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Set.Quot` (new file)|687|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Quot.ext`
`+ Quot.mem_coe`
`+ Represents`
`+ exact`
`+ instance : SetLike (Quot r) Œ±`
`+ ncard_inter`
`+ ncard_sdiff_of_mem`
`+ ncard_sdiff_of_not_mem`
`+ out_image_represents`
`+ unique_rep`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Adopted all suggestions by @EtienneC30, thanks!

One last comment: after defining the structure, you use the variables `{C : Set (Quot r)} {s : Set Œ±} {c : Quot r}` in nearly all lemmas. If you want you can introduce them once for all the results by doing `variable {C : Set (Quot r)} {s : Set Œ±} {c : Quot r}` just before `ncard_represents_inter`. You could even put `variable [Fintype Œ±]` before `ncard_sdiff_represents_of_mem` if you want. This is merely a suggestion, feel free to disregard it if you prefer to keep it that way.

Thanks!
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by EtienneC30.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/fc599928-9e55-4a08-aa38-05cac177908a) for commit a5a94d14d027dad532059e58c96884e25a2e6bb2.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/a2f9496a-64fd-4d8e-9d1f-1c2e44e71e58/to/fc599928-9e55-4a08-aa38-05cac177908a) against commit a1037826c282716733ec9a54c9dc4599677ac3bc.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+14.106‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Abelian.NonPreadditive`|+1.48‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+4.02%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13050281818)
On hold, likely to be superseded by #20024
Filling the lines
Thank you for this! I left some suggestions for shortening / readability / mathlib-friendly.
We're almost there!
Filling the lines

If you mean set in natural language please don't capitalize.
```suggestion
/-- Convert an equivalence class to a `Set`. -/
```

I'm guessing you wrote `V` for vertices, but as this is a general file I think it's better to call it `Œ±` as we usually do for general types. Also no need for an explicit universe parameter.
```suggestion
variable {Œ± : Type*} {r : Œ± ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Prop}
```

You can do
```suggestion
  coe_injective' x y h := by
```

```suggestion
    simpa using show x.out ‚àà {v | Quot.mk r v = y} by
```
This name seems a bit lengthy and not very explicit. Maybe `out_image_rep_self`?
Changed it to `out_image_represents`

This also works if you want.
```suggestion
    (Quot.out '' C).Represents C where
```

You can also do that, as you wish.
```suggestion
      exact x.out_eq
```

```suggestion
    refine ‚ü®‚ü®by aesop, Quot.out_eq _‚ü©, fun y hy hyc ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
```

```suggestion
    rw [‚Üê hyc, c'.out_eq]
```

```suggestion
  exact {c} h := by
```

This also works:
```suggestion
    rw [‚Üê hvc, ‚Üê hv, c'.out_eq] at h
    exact h hc'
```

```suggestion
    {c : Quot r} (hrep : s.Represents C) (h : c ‚àâ C) : Disjoint s c := by
```
Same in the lemma below.

You don't have to stack the arguments, it makes the header unnecessarily heavy.
```suggestion
lemma disjoint_of_represents {c : Quot r} {s : Set V} {p : Quot r ‚Üí Prop}
    (hrep : s.Represents {c | p c}) (h : ¬¨ p c) : Disjoint s c := by
```

```suggestion
  simpa
```
Seems nicer. Also I think we want to avoid squeezed terminal simp, although this has been discussed recently on Zulip.

```suggestion
lemma ncard_sdiff_represents_of_mem [Fintype Œ±] {c : Quot r}
    {s : Set Œ±} {C : Set (Quot r)} (hrep : s.Represents C) (h : c ‚àà C) :
    ((c : Set Œ±) \ s).ncard = (c : Set Œ±).ncard - 1 := by
```
Could you please either:
- put the hypotheses on the first two lines and single out the goal on a third line as I did here, to make the statement easier to read, or
- put everything on two lines. This makes the goal less readable but saves a line.

Same remark for the lemma below.
I've done the second one for the whole file:)
Because you open the namespace you can remove all the `Set.` prefixes from the lemmas you use in your proofs.
Done:)

This lemma is definitionally the same as above so you can just do
```suggestion
lemma disjoint_of_represents {c : Quot r} {s : Set Œ±} {p : Quot r ‚Üí Prop}
    (hrep : s.Represents {c | p c}) (h : ¬¨ p c) : Disjoint s c :=
  disjoint_represents hrep h
```
Because of this, I suggest that you give them the same name and add a prime to the one which seems less useful to you (I'd go for the second version but I don't know your use case).
I think it would suffice to just keep one, so I kept the first one:)

```suggestion
lemma ncard_represents_inter {C : Set (Quot r)} {s : Set Œ±} {c : Quot r} (hrep : s.Represents C)
```
Fixed by introducing variables:)

```suggestion
lemma ncard_represents_inter (hrep : s.Represents C) (h : c ‚àà C) : (s ‚à© c).ncard = 1 := by
```

```suggestion
    simp only [mem_inter_iff, mem_image, mem_empty_iff_false, iff_false, not_and,
      forall_exists_index, and_imp]
```

```suggestion
  simp [‚Üê ncard_inter_add_ncard_diff_eq_ncard c s (toFinite _), inter_comm,
    ncard_represents_inter hrep h]
```

```suggestion
  simp [‚Üê ncard_inter_add_ncard_diff_eq_ncard c s (toFinite _), inter_comm, hrep.exact h]
```

Perhaps
```suggestion
  exact {c : Quot r} (h : c ‚àâ C) : Disjoint s c
```
Fixed:)
Can you add the other theorems that the module docstring for `SetLike` prescribes? For instance, that `v ‚àà c \iff Quot.mk r v = c`?
I added the mem and ext lemma's. If the copy lemma's also apply here I'm not really sure how to implement that, so if it does, I'd appreciate a pointer:)
I think skipping `copy` is fine.
Is this the same as `Set.BijOn Quot.mk s C`?
Yep. That seems very clean. I switched to that as the definition and proved the previous components as results

Note that because of the way that `SetLike` works, this is _not_ about `toSet`, this is about `SetLike.coe`! It probably would be best to inline `{x | Quot.mk r x = c}` into the `SetLike` instance so that there is not a stray definition around.
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma Quot.mem_coe {x : Œ±} {c : Quot r} : x ‚àà c ‚Üî Quot.mk r x = c := Iff.rfl
```

```suggestion
/-- A quotient element can be interpreted as the set of elements in the same equivalence class. -/
instance : SetLike (Quot r) Œ± where
```
Is there a general result about `BijOn` and functions which satisfy `mk (out x) = x` (`RightInverse`) here?

```suggestion
def Represents (s : Set Œ±) (C : Set (Quot r)) : Prop := Set.BijOn (Quot.mk r) s C
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Set): representing the equivalence classes of a Quot
